content.rendered:
Latest Posts
Stay up to date with all our latest news and launches. Only the best quality makes it onto our blog!

  • Community Sharing Part 1: Sharing Sets – Your First Step in Sharing

    Sharing Sets are an amazing superpower that comes with your Communities. They are a way to share with Community License types and Community users. Keep in mind, this type of security and sharing is only available for your community users, it is not available to share with internal users.

    October 29, 2019

  • Community Sharing Part 2: Guest Page Visibility

    This post we expore guest user visibily in Experience Cloud. Every Community has a Guest User and Guest User Profile. A guest is someone that can see your community before they login – an Unauthenticated user. Each time a community or portal is created, Salesforce auto-creates a guest user profile and a site guest user record. No matter what, even if your community is authenticated, you have a guest user and the site guest user record is the only user record associated with the guest user profile.

    February 13, 2020

  • Community Sharing Part 3: Channel Programs

    We have talked about Sharing Sets, Page Visibility and Guests, now we are going a bit of a different directions, how to take those pages and take the users and find out how to make then into different groups for audiences, folders, sharing groups, managing resources, and standard partner categories all at once. SHNIKES! I bet you’re like ‘girl, what feature are you talking about?’ Well the feature we are talking about here is available with just Partner Community/Partner Community Login licenses and it’s called Channel Programs. What are Channel Programs exactly? Great question, let’s break that down to the core.

    September 8, 2020

    • Welly User Group: Community Cloud Expert

      Join me to talk Community Cloud security from scratch or audit your existing. We’ll review how to setup sharing sets, account relationships, channel programs, Apex sharing, profiles, and licenses. Better how the types of sharing work together, how to decide when to use each, and best practices for implementing a secure Community. I’ll even share some awesome apps to help you check guest perms, monitor, and maintain your user access to keep things running smoothly and your data safe and sound. Session Link Cinco De Mayo for Salesforce YYC!! Join the Calgary User Group and me to learn about Community Cloud use cases for Partner, Customer, and unauthenticated Communities.we’ll dive into the different ways you can use Communities from submitting Leads and Opportunities, Self Service help portals, sharing content and more! Learn about how others use Community Cloud to connect, build their brand and better relationships; inspiring you to see the infinite possibilities for you and your Community.

      December 1, 2020

  • Automation Hour w/ Meighan Brodkey Community Non-Account Based Sharing

    Meighan Brodkey presents a great session on Rollup Summary Fields with Lookups. Meighan takes the standard “Rollup” mentality to the next level with dynamic rollups based on what type of record is connected to the record. An awesome scenario that can show you how to take your automation to the next level! Also, lots of great questions so plenty for everyone of all skills to learn from.

    November 23, 2020

  • Vancouver User Group: Become a Community Cloud Security Expert

    Join me to talk Community Cloud security from scratch or audit your existing. We’ll review how to setup sharing sets, account relationships, channel programs, Apex sharing, profiles, and licenses. Better how the types of sharing work together, how to decide when to use each, and best practices for implementing a secure Community. I’ll even share some awesome apps to help you check guest perms, monitor, and maintain your user access to keep things running smoothly and your data safe and sound. Session Link Cinco De Mayo for Salesforce YYC!! Join the Calgary User Group and me to learn about Community Cloud use cases for Partner, Customer, and unauthenticated Communities.we’ll dive into the different ways you can use Communities from submitting Leads and Opportunities, Self Service help portals, sharing content and more! Learn about how others use Community Cloud to connect, build their brand and better relationships; inspiring you to see the infinite possibilities for you and your Community.

    May 15, 2020
